more_relevant_posts.post_text: Today, as we celebrate the 70th anniversary of Brown v. Board of Education, it's not too late to read our May issue for a deep dive into the ruling's history and its significance: https://lnkd.in/eCPT-Jcu

“One of the beauties of being human is that there are so many perspectives to learn from. You can’t learn everything about everyone, but just take a step to learn about people’s struggles, victories, and contributions to the world at large." Check out this inspiring piece on Juneteenth and creating a more inclusive future from McKinstry 's Lavell Flamon:

🌟 Are You READI? 🌟 How much do you know about Racial Equity, Access, Diversity, and Inclusion (READI)? We specialize in tackling some of the most pressing organizational issues of equity and inclusion through our unique asset-based, participatory approach. Our team of expert facilitators is dedicated to fostering environments where everyone feels valued and included. Discover why nationwide organizations trust us to guide their journey toward greater equity and inclusion. Learn More Here: https://lnkd.in/gTwxdPSc

This is really important. There are legitimate debates to be had about DEI practice and theory, but there is absolutely no reason to back away from racial justice. In particular, there is no reason why monied foundations or other organizations should misinterpret and incorrectly over-apply the Supreme Court's ruling on affirmative action programs in public universities to back away from fair treatment and expanding opportunity for Black, Hispanic, and Indigenous Americans in any context. The majority of Americans, including many conservatives, believe that there is still much progress that needs to be made. Applause to MacArthur Foundation . Key Quote: "While the United States Supreme Court and some laws prohibit the use of race as a 'but for' or 'plus factor' in some settings, it remains lawful to attend to the consequences of our decisions and to choose actions to help address historical and present-day racial inequities."

Do you know the way to AISNE's 2024 Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Conference? Pan, the furry friend of author Stephanie Seales, is helping to point the way! Stephanie is joining a panel of fellow children's and YA literature authors to discuss how books shape and uplift us. At the conference? Share you pictures here on LinkedIn!

Championing Change: The Clifford Walker Story In this episode, Clifford Walker, a Portland native born in 1943, shares his life story. He discusses his upbringing in Portland's Eastside, attending Jefferson High School, and the racial discrimination he faced in a predominantly white community. Clifford reflects on his family's history, including his father's activism as a Portland politician advocating for public accommodations for people of color. He recounts experiences with racism and segregation, highlighting challenges such as encountering signs that read "white trade only" as a child. Clifford also shares memories from his time in the Air Force as a military policeman and discusses racial tensions within the military. He concludes by discussing his involvement with the Oregon Commission on Black Affairs and efforts to address racial injustices in Oregon. Clifford emphasizes the significance of preserving local history and encouraging future generations to engage in activism. He shares anecdotes about grassroots efforts to improve educational opportunities and access to healthcare for marginalized communities in Portland. Key Takeaways: The importance of resilience and hard work in overcoming adversity. The role of community and advocacy in driving social change. The need for continued efforts towards racial equity and justice in America. Clifford Walker's dedication to public service and entrepreneurship. Clifford's reflections on the challenges faced by the black community in Portland. Follow: Find us on all social platforms @oregonhiddenlegacy for updates on upcoming episodes and exclusive content. Listener Feedback: Share your thoughts and stories about Clifford Walker's journey on our website www.oregonhiddenlegacy.org . We'd love to hear from you! #SocialJustice , #CommunityLeadership , #Resilience , #MilitaryService , #PoliticalEngagement , #Portland , #BlackCommunity , #Advocacy , #Equity , #ChangeMakers , #Podcast , #Inspiration , #Oregon , #Hidden , #Legacy , #OralHistory , #Interviews , #Storytelling , #Archive , #Albina , #UnrepresentedCommunities , #FamilyFirst , #LSB41Studios , #GMPPodcastGroup , #thorncitysyndicate https://lnkd.in/gqpzPyzw

Across all levels -- from board members, executive, senior staff, and all staff -- people of color are dropping out of the conservation movement. The data in the pages of this year's Green 2.0 transparency report card match the anecdotal evidence I've seen over the last two years. The concerted attack on justice, equity, diversity, and inclusion is working. Whether it's discontinuing diversity programs, or ending fellowship programs, or just not addressing the culture of racism and white supremacy, the end result is we are losing people in our movement, and we are less effective as a result. https://lnkd.in/ee5HxhDJ

Calling all outdoor industry professionals!! Sign up before September 4 for the Racial Justice Weavings, Fall 2024 Season. The Weavings are a weekly online gathering for outdoor industry folks to learn about and grapple with white supremacy, racism, and racial justice in outdoor education and recreation in the US. Anyone working in the outdoor industry is welcome, no matter their role or level of experience. We don't assume any previous knowledge about racism in outdoor spaces, just a willingness to have the conversation. Yes, there's a requested cost because we all live in this rabidly exploitative late capitalist hellscape, and we're trying to make this work sustainable BUT: 1. BIPOC folks ride for free and 2. We will not let cost be a barrier to anyone participating. Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/eV4kceCJ Sign up here: https://lnkd.in/e5c7Pc-s We'll leave you with a few words from the Weavings crew: "Hey, dominant culture peeps! If you’re baffled but open to getting help in understanding why your DEI game still isn't really on, GW&D is the deeper dive you're looking for." Paul Duba, MPA, PCC, NCC "Thanks to this cohort led by Ella and Steph, I am growing in ways that profoundly impact my career, how I show up for my community and personal relationships, and my role as a parent." AJ Wojtalik "Steph and Ella are intentional and expert facilitators with expertise in coaching and consulting. In their antiracism practice, they hold space for curiosity and growth while firmly interrupting bias and harm. Their coaching is guided by compassion for everyone involved." Briana Golden Copeland "Steph and Ella are fantastic facilitators. They built an environment where I was very comfortable being uncomfortable. They developed a learning community of outdoor educators with various levels of experience and roles from seasonal field staff all the way up to executive leadership. I learned a lot about racial justice. I also picked up some communication tools that I use with my leadership team on a regular basis." Ben Fickett

The 𝐖𝐚𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐨𝐫 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐆𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐢𝐧 𝐆𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐂𝐢𝐯𝐢𝐜 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐚𝐠𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐂𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐨𝐫𝐲 honors organizations and initiatives that inspire good governance, redefine leadership, champion social inclusion, and build diverse social movements to drive transformative change across communities, governments, and businesses. These organizations are dedicated to influencing public policy, promoting accountability, and amplifying citizen voices to ensure the integrity and effectiveness of public institutions. By fostering dialogue, facilitating multi-stakeholder policy discussions, and creating sustainable governance solutions, they address critical societal challenges through programs that set new standards in governance, and drive a culture of transparency, integrity, and shared responsibility. Nominate these initiatives that promote civic responsibility and engagement through leadership development, youth empowerment, civic education, networking opportunities, and skills-building, equipping communities and young people to advocate for transparency, social justice, and inclusive socio-economic development here https://lnkd.in/dtQB7akD

post_text_html: What an honor to be included as one of the responsible 100.

repost.repost_text: The Responsible 100 Award is about serving others, and there's no better example than Susan Matloff-Nieves. As a leader and scholar, she has helped professionalize youth services across NYC. In her current role as VP of Innovation and Justice, she ensures we always have our sights set on creating a better and fairer world. Congratulations Susan!

title: Michelle Dunscombe on LinkedIn: SEE Training & Development Facilitator - Bidwern Butj Uni - Job in Darwin…
headline: Michelle Dunscombe’s Post
post_text: Be a part of our SEE First Nations project team. Enjoy a balance of time between Darwin & Arnhem Land whilst working on our unique codesigned community literacy project. https://lnkd.in/gJnk4pUp

more_relevant_posts.post_text: I’ve just completed the Enterprise and Community Development Level 6 course with EQUAL Ireland, gaining valuable insights into both personal growth and community empowerment. This comprehensive program covered a range of topics, including: 📚 Learning to Learn: Mastering goal setting, motivation, and effective study strategies. 🗣️ Communications: Enhancing skills in digital, verbal, and non-verbal communication, as well as research and presentation. 💼 Enterprise Development: Exploring entrepreneurship, business planning, and the importance of social enterprise. 🌍 Sociology: Gaining a deep understanding of sociological theories and social issues like inequality and institutions. 🌱 Community Development: Delving into principles and practices to empower communities and foster sustainable development. 💻 IT Skills: Learning to navigate essential applications like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, with a focus on internet safety. I’m excited to apply these skills to help build stronger communities and support sustainable enterprises.

🔦 Community Spotlight 🔦 Racial Definitions & Cultural Responsiveness Training with Cross Cultural Community Services When: November 14th, 9am-12pm ET Where: Virtual We will review: - the Zones of Comfort, Risk, and Danger to engage in a dialogue about participants and the discomfort some may feel when discussing race. - social and racial definitions such as microaggressions, bias, stereotypes, and systemic racism so everyone is aware of what we mean when we use these terms. - a short clip about discussing race and then divide the group into small groups to discuss their reactions. - the Continuum of cultural responsiveness, discuss cultural humility and explain why cultural awareness is instantaneous for people and organizations. Register: https://lnkd.in/gB5fXQiJ

My sense of vocation was given renewed lift in the recent work on Systems Convening. Ahh! The what and how of my work are observed and validated beyond my own experience and practice. Training in Systems Convening is well worth the time for anyone who convenes groups of people to do good and transformational work. Learn more about upcoming training possibilities here: https://lnkd.in/g9GnkQMB #systemsconvening #processconsulting

I just checked we do already have this TAFE course. I think there is also a TAFE course on facilitation. I will explore more soon, and I will check to what extent this course covers participatory and deliberative democracy best practice. I doubt it does. To date I understand participatory and deliberative democracy to only be taught through universities including by us previously at ISTP and then at CUSP and by UTS. It requires teaching an in depth understanding of how power works (or in reality doesn't - instead it concentrates within this system, and it is used primarily in conflict to impose agendas and half-truths, it is not used wisely or collaboratively). I think only UTS is currently teaching this. It would be a good idea to teach through TAFE which would be more affordable and accessible. I would be very happy coming up with a Cert IV. I know the training system well including having managed a TAFE. Happy to chat to anybody including other orgs as to whether they would like to partner on this and other topics. A Cert IV on participatory and deliberative democracy and changing the Local Govt Act to make best practice engagement mandatory would go a long way to help the future in WA. It is not my first priority, but it is on now on my list (after I check out fully what is currently being offered by TAFE). It could probably be a Diploma if you included the full range of concepts and skills required to practice.

Successfully completed Two days Training Workshop on "Role of Local Government in building Resilience, Pluralism and Peace". The workshop was aimed to delve into the pivotal role Local Government plays in fostering resilience, promoting pluralism and maintaining peace within communities. The workshop provided a dynamic platform to share ideas and experiences on how citizen actions can contribute to good governance. The workshop also facilitated discussions on practical strategies and tools that can be utilized by local government to enhance citizen participation and promote good governance practices. It concluded with a strong message emphasizing the crucial role of citizen actions in building Resilient, Pluralistic and Peaceful communities.

📚 Lifelong Learning: A Key to Growth in Social Work 📚 I’ve always believed that growth in our professional practice doesn’t stop at graduation—it’s a lifelong journey. As a social worker, it’s essential to keep expanding our knowledge, staying informed about evolving best practices, and understanding the legal landscape to serve our communities effectively. As a teacher, I take pride in bringing relevant cases and real-world topics into the classroom, ensuring future social workers are well-prepared to navigate the complex challenges they’ll face. This weekend, I’m excited to dive into a comprehensive Legal Guide that will help me further refine my knowledge and skills. Here’s to continuously learning and sharing knowledge for a better future! 💪🌟 #SocialWork #LifelongLearning #Education #SocialWorkEducation #ProfessionalGrowth #LegalGuide #OASW

Last week, PSBA professional development team presented our Dive into Roles & Responsibilities Workshop in Parkland School District . Through facilitated discussions, the group covered some of the challenges of community engagement, board deliberation and governance vs. management responsibilities. Courses like this help unify your Team of 10 and strengthen the collective work of the board! Learn more about the workshop and other #PSBAProfessionalDevelopment programs on myPSBA.org .

🚀 We’re Launching! 🚀 We are excited to announce the launch of our new service in Swindon, committed to enhancing education and well-being outcomes for disadvantaged children and young people. 🌟 Our mission is simple: empowering young minds through inclusive, evidence-based teaching practices to equip them with the skills needed for success in life, learning, and careers. ✨ 🎯 Our Key Aims: ♡ Improve education and well-being outcomes for young people with complex needs. ♡ Provide local alternatives to out-of-area placements, keeping families together. ♡ Stabilise and integrate students back into small-group learning. ♡ Prepare students for future education, training, or employment. 🩷 Our Alternative Provision (AP) Principles: 1. Every student’s learning is understood and supported individually. 2. Evidence-based methods shape our everyday practices. 3. Co-learning spaces create a safe base for collaboration. 4, We use role modeling and scaffolding to inspire. 5. Language is essential in communication and growth. 6. Resilience is the key to empowering future success. 💡 We’re here to make a lasting impact on the lives of young people in our community, fostering growth, resilience, and opportunity. Stay tuned for more updates, and join us on this incredible journey! #EducationForAll #EmpowerYoungMinds #SwindonYouth #InclusiveLearning #WellBeingMatters #Alternativeprovision

My Professional Goals and Aspirations🤩 As part of my 7 day posting challenge at Royal Revamp, that is charting the course for my professional journey, my aspirations extend far beyond conventional success. I envision a future where I am not only a leader in education but I also mold young minds not just in academics but also in the essential core values crucial to building a better society. What drives me? ~ I am driven by my profound passion for education that extends beyond academic learning to include the cultivation of essential values. This drive to nurture young minds with not only knowledge but also ethics motivates me everyday towards the achievement of my goals. ~ I am also driven by the desire to make a meaningful impact on underserved communities through different initiatives that highlights my commitment to social responsibility and the SDG number 4, Quality Education. When I was younger I used to follow my mom on the visits she would go on with the Non Governmental Organization she worked at. I witnessed the harsh reality of run- down schools, disadvantaged pupils and unenthusiastic teachers and that marked a significant turning point that fueled my desire towards addressing significant educational inequalities. ~My professional ambition in general extends to the global stage, particularly within the United Nations framework. I am dedicated to contributing to Sustainable Development Goal 4, which focuses on ensuring inclusive and quality education for all. I aspire to drive positive change on a broader scale, influencing policies and initiatives that advance education globally. #professionalgrowth #royalrevamp

Interested in boosting #inclusion in your workplace or university? Check out the IN-WORK Handbook: https://lnkd.in/dPrkmEhV . 🎫 Free access and downloadable 🌍 Available in 5 languages This Training Handbook will help you implement work integrated learning (WIL) activities. It will guide you through how to train staff, teachers or other stakeholders so they can guide and supervise students with special needs. 📝 Have you read it? Let us know what you think! Anna Maria Mariani Teresa Torres-Coronas Kaija Peuna-Korpioja

title: Fiona Corvan on LinkedIn: If you know me personally, you’ll know I’m a big picture thinker… | 27 comments
headline: Fiona Corvan’s Post
post_text: If you know me personally, you’ll know I’m a big picture thinker, committed to ‘this place’ - striving to contribute positively here - even in challenging or sensitive circumstances. I’ve embarked on a new opportunity at ICRIR. Moving from a small organisation back to a large and complex one, working on a differently focused remit, practising and refining another skillset, getting to grips with a new culture. All change. At the core of it though - an unwavering commitment to peace and reconciliation remains. I may no longer walk into the office via the Garden of Reflection in Derry everyday, but all those reflections are still there. [Along with my love for the many words that adorn the walls] 🩷 ‘Further shore is reachable from here.’ 💫

more_relevant_posts.post_text: You never know when your next opportunity will come. Whether it's a chance meeting, a new connection, or a role opening up unexpectedly, the key is to stay ready. Opportunities can appear when you least expect them—be prepared to seize them! Shift Group will get you ready! www.shiftgroup.io to learn more and get started!

It's been over a year since I resumed my current job, and I've come a long way from battling imposter syndrome. It was tough at first, especially since it's my first structured HR/Admin role, but I didn't give up, and I'm so proud of how much I've grown. If you're feeling the same way, second-guessing yourself, just know that it's okay. It's normal to feel that way in a new job. But you'll get through it, just like I did. Here are a few things that really helped me: 1. Remind yourself that it's all part of the process. New job, new environment, new challenges - it's all part of the journey. 2. Take your time to understand the company, its values, and your role. It really helped me settle in and feel more confident. 3. Get to know your boss and their expectations. Understanding my manager's work style made a big difference for me. 4. Celebrate your victories, no matter how small. Those little wins will keep you going on the tougher days. And to everyone out there who've just achieved something amazing, whether it's a new job, scholarship, promotion, or contract - congratulations! You deserve it! And for those still waiting for their big break, keep pushing forward. Your time will come, I promise. Congratulations to everyone! 🎉🥳🎉

You know that statement; something worth doing is worth doing well… 🦋 ermmm how do I explain this 🤔🤔 🦋 Ok let me use another one…That thing you know how to do, do it well and you just might get paid for doing your hobby or favorite thing…now I think this is simple and clear. 🦋 What am I driving at, I enjoy arranging people’s lives, schedules, setting and managing new teams, following through on projects till I see the results, planning and executing events, communicating with people on behalf of others(Liason Mgt), listening to people in general, they are my favorite things to do in this world. 🦋 I decided to make a career out of it. Being an EA/Chief of Staff is not because ohh this is the only job I could find, it’s a job I love…it’s a job I find purpose in. I wake up and I’m able to get an Executive be fully productive, like my boss will say, we wake up, make decisions, go out and do great things. 🦋 So in that current role of yours, do it not because that’s the only role available or you just happened to find yourself in it, Do it because you are impacting the world and yourself by making those decisions and baby steps 🤭

Sure! Here are four points you might consider: 1. Opportunity for Adventure: Joining you means experiencing something new and exciting together. 2. Strengthening Friendship: Spending time together can deepen our bond and create lasting memories. 3. Shared Interests: If we have common interests, it’ll be more enjoyable to explore them side by side. 4. Support and Motivation: Having someone along can make challenges easier and more fun to tackle.

I was offered a promotion today. I’m gonna keep the details about it hidden, respectfully, but I wanted to let my network know of something: This world we live in is very chaotic. The job market is also chaotic; you can only respect it as much. But in the midst of the light, there is a solution: Find a company you’d like to work for. It doesn’t matter the position — just work for them. Attempt to maintain perfect attendance, kindly explain what your goals are, and show the upmost respect for your coworkers. Before you know it, that position you’re looking for will come to YOU. Because YOU matter. And you care about the company you’re working for. In this day and age, the two most things that go missing is respect and common sense. They can be easily picked up. And once you’ve mastered them, they make the ultimate weapons in your arsenal. Have a great day everybody!

These days trying to summarize in one page what has been learnt, achieved, sometimes struggled, nevertheless always with joy, passion, true engagement, respect to others, within more than 20 years of professional activity and to convert these accumulated skills, expertise, lessons, efforts, delivered projects and set up processes for smooth operations, network & connections, languages and trips, into the value proposition which can bring me just towards right place, people & role 🙏

I met Gill Scott FRSA in 2016 at the National Museum. She was humble and knowledgeable right from the start. In 2022, she became my boss, and I learned a lot from her tireless guidance and enthusiasm. Together, we led many successful projects, including our last project "Perfumes of the East" exhibition, which we completed in just seven months - a remarkable feat for an international exhibition. With Gill's guideline everything is possible. I wold like to summarize my experience with this wonderful leader: : ⭐️ No matter how satisfied you feel with your current skillset, there's always room for professional development. ⭐️ Be proactive in your career and take advantage of opportunities that come your way. ⭐️Guiding your employees with compassion and understanding can foster a productive and rewarding work environment. ⭐️Building strong working relationships starts with mutual respect. ⭐️It's important to listen attentively to your employees and understand their needs. ⭐️Always aim to be the best version of yourself, both personally and professionally. ⭐️Achieving your goals often requires hard work and persistence. Don't give up easily! Good luck with your new job at Misk Foundation , how lucky they are 💓

📢 Stepping into the Role of CPCO: A New Chapter I’m thrilled to share that I’m officially stepping into the role of Chief People and Culture Officer (CPCO) at Forga. 🚀 Shifting from Creative to HR might seem unexpected, but I’ve never been one to stick to the obvious path. This is my second career pivot, and it feels like the right move at exactly the right time. ✨ It wasn’t a sudden leap. As Forga grew, I naturally found myself leaning into this space. It’s something I’ve been passionate about for a while—just didn’t quite know how to define it until now. What’s changing? Not much. I’ll still be doing what I love: communicating, solving problems, and, yes, dragging people into workshops 😄. Creativity? Still at the core. Now, I’m channeling it into building a culture where challenges are embraced, resilience grows, and collaboration thrives. 🌱 But that’s just my take. Culture is a team sport, and I’m here to shape it with all of you, Forgatians. 💪 So, let me be officially CPCO for a while. I’ll keep refining the vision and maybe even practice my creative writing while I’m at it. 😅 Let’s design a new meaning.

Time really flies! Last week marked my fourth anniversary at SHC , and reflecting on this journey, I'm struck by how rich and transformative these years have been. I'm sharing this post not just to celebrate a personal milestone but because the insights I've gained across different roles at SHC are too valuable not to share. These experiences have deeply influenced my professional path, and I believe they can inspire and guide many of you in your own careers. Over these four years, I've worn three distinct hats—𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀, 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗲𝘀. Each role offered unique challenges and learning opportunities that have profoundly shaped my approach to business. ▶ In 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀, my goal was to deeply understand our software and ensure our customers felt supported and valued. This role underscored the importance of listening attentively and solving problems effectively, which are crucial skills in any customer-facing job. ▶ Transitioning to 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵, I collaborated closely with our development team to enhance our product based on real user feedback. This experience taught me the importance of innovation and simplicity in creating tech solutions that not only function well but are also user-friendly. ▶ In 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗲𝘀, I learned to simplify our complex tech talk into clear, client-friendly language. It was all about connecting our products to real-world needs and helping clients see the tangible benefits we offer, without getting bogged down in jargon. Now, I'm really excited to share what I've learned from these three different perspectives. They've not only helped me grow professionally but also given me a well-rounded view of our business. I think these insights could be super helpful for others in our industry too. A huge thanks to my incredible team for supporting me throughout this journey! I’m looking forward to sharing more, learning more, and connecting with all of you. Praveen Kashyap Mike Alpert Ruchika Kashyap Armaan Bhaskaran Akshay Srivastava #milestone #personaljourney #healthindustry #learn #grow

Here's the thing: Even if you enjoy your job, is this really the work you were meant to be doing? Our talents and abilities are more than just hobbies. They're our life's calling; they're who we are as people 👨👩👧👦. And that means if we aren't living out our true calling, we're wasting an incredible opportunity to grow personally and professionally. When we ignore our true calling, it's tough to feel fulfilled 🙌. And that can lead to frustration and discontent with the work we're doing. If we instead figure out a way to leverage our unique talents and abilities and turn them into a career we find meaningful, we'll be able to be the best versions of ourselves as leaders and as people 💪.

more_relevant_posts.post_text: We invite the community to learn about the evolution of the Purdue Extension Community Development Program (CDEXT), and how our program helps address community development needs in Indiana. You will receive our newsletter every month, with valuable information that can be shared with others freely. Please subscribe to our newsletter today! https://bit.ly/44KGD3Q #PurdueExtension #communitydevelopmentprogram #cdext #communitydevelopment #newsletter #newslettersignup #Indiana

See how CDCs are expanding beyond housing to become crucial educational partners. From crisis intervention to bilingual programs, these organizations are reimagining their role in community success. Listen to learn more today: https://bit.ly/3OBXMWo #CommunityDevelopment #Education #Housing #Partnerships

Ready to explore the complexities of community development? Our latest Under the Lens series takes a closer look at this ever-evolving field. With organizations engaging in various activities to meet the needs of their communities, community development is as diverse as the communities it serves. However, it's not without its challenges. Legal threats, shifting funding priorities, and the persistent specter of structural racism are just a few of the issues facing community development today. Yet amidst these challenges lie windows of opportunity. Our editor's note offers a glimpse into the discussions, highlighting the top issues and potential avenues for progress. Join us as we navigate the landscape of community development together. Read editors note: https://bit.ly/3y03Hzv #CommunityBuilding #EquitableDevelopment #ShapingFutures

🌟New blog alert!🌟 I'm thrilled to introduce "Beyond Half Full", my new blog about asset-based/complementary approaches to community development. Curious about turning problems into opportunities? This one's for you! 💡 My first post explores restorative practices and their incredible impact on building stronger, more connected communities. Check it out and join the conversation: https://lnkd.in/gUERTp59 #CommunityDevelopment #RestorativePractices #AssetBasedCommunityDevelopment

Just came across this interesting article about the the concept of "predatory versus progressive community development." The article raises some eye-opening questions in the community development world, where we often pride ourselves on making a positive impact. Could our efforts to "help" ever be doing more harm than good? 💭 Predatory or Progressive? 💭 🤔 I'd love to hear thoughts from those in the community development space, what do you think? #CommunityDevelopment #SocialImpact #MunicipalEnquiry #FoodForThought

more_relevant_posts.post_text: Thank you, International Labour Organization , for highlighting the intersection of social protection and climate resilience. It's crucial that we extend and strengthen social protection systems to safeguard vulnerable communities disproportionately impacted by the climate crisis. By promoting a just transition, we can ensure that those most affected are not left behind as we move towards a sustainable future. Proud to have joined the discussion in exploring how we can build a more equitable world together. #ClimateJustice #SocialProtection #JustTransition

Excellent initiative International Labour Organization .. Social protection is essential to shield the most vulnerable from the climate crisis for several reasons: ■ #Protectionfromclimaterelatedshocks : Social protection programs can provide financial support and resources to help vulnerable populations recover from climate-related disasters and shocks. ■ #Reducingpovertyandinequality : Social protection can help reduce poverty and inequality by providing a safety net for those most affected by climate change. ■ #Promotingclimateresilience : Social protection can help build climate resilience by supporting climate-smart agriculture, water management, and other adaptive measures. ■ #Supportinghumanrights : Social protection is essential for ensuring the human rights of vulnerable populations are protected in the face of climate change. ■ #Empoweringwomenandgirls : Social protection can empower women and girls, who are often disproportionately affected by climate change. ■ #Supportingmarginalizedcommunities : Social protection can reach marginalized communities, including indigenous peoples, who are often most vulnerable to climate change. ■ #Fosteringinclusiveclimateaction : Social protection can help ensure climate action is inclusive and leaves no one behind. ■ #Reducingmigrationanddisplacement : Social protection can help reduce migration and displacement caused by climate change. ■ #Promotingsustainabledevelopment : Social protection can support sustainable development by reducing poverty and inequality. ■ #Urgentneed : The climate crisis requires immediate action, and social protection is an essential part of the response. By #providing a safety net and supporting climate resilience, social protection can help shield the #mostvulnerable from the #climatecrisis and promote a more #equitableandsustainablefuture . ONU Climat United Nations UNDP UNDP Sustainable Finance Hub Sustainable Development Solutions Network UN Sustainable Development Group European Economic and Social Committee IDLO - International Development Law Organization UNOPS .

In the face of the climate crisis, vulnerable communities are hit the hardest. Extending social protection can be a powerful tool to help these communities cope with the devastating effects of climate change while promoting a fair transition to a sustainable future. Our latest podcast discusses the crucial role of social protection systems in building resilience and supporting those most at risk. Joining the discussion is Kumi Naidoo , a South African human rights and environmental justice activist, President of the Fossil Fuel Non-Proliferation Treaty, and Payne Distinguished Lecturer at Stanford University. 🎧Tune in here: https://ow.ly/TyBw50TGEI6

In the face of the climate crisis, vulnerable communities are hit the hardest. Extending social protection can be a powerful tool to help these communities cope with the devastating effects of climate change while promoting a fair transition to a sustainable future. Our latest podcast discusses the crucial role of social protection systems in building resilience and supporting those most at risk. Joining the discussion is Kumi Naidoo , a South African human rights and environmental justice activist, President of the Fossil Fuel Non-Proliferation Treaty, and Payne Distinguished Lecturer at Stanford University. 🎧Tune in here: https://lnkd.in/efRAUJqz

Global civil society engagement for an International Court of Justice (ICJ) advisory opinion on climate change originated from Pacific youth, and was taken on by the Government of Vanuatu, alongside Pacific, African, and Caribbean governments. At the same time, the journey to the ICJ has been driven by a global youth and civil society movement that for more than four years has tirelessly lobbied governments worldwide to advocate for legal action on climate change. At the forefront of this effort is World's Youth for Climate Justice (WYCJ) , a network of over a thousand campaigners operating across national and regional fronts who, in partnership with the Pacific Island Students Fighting Climate Change, have mobilized youth, States, and civil society around the world behind this historic climate case. Each of these regions had unique experiences, realities, needs, capacities, awareness, interests, and perceptions of the Court that varied greatly – and so did civil society approaches to garner State and non-State actor support in their respective regions. This piece explores the youth-led campaign behind the push for the ICJ climate change advisory opinion.
This conversation will be key to generating valuable climate change education strategy for Australia!

🌍✨ The International Court of Justice (ICJ) is about to make a historic decision on the obligations of States regarding climate change. As the deadline for States to submit their views on climate justice to the ICJ approaches (March 22nd), your support is crucial in urging your government to share their perspectives. The recent low participation of the States in the context of the Inter-American Court of Human Rights advisory opinion highlights the importance of the role of civil society members. Gathering behind this initiative led by the World's Youth for Climate Justice (WYCJ) and Pacific Islands Students Fighting Climate Change , which we support as our partner, is crucial. What can you do? -> Encourage your government to submit progressive statements on human rights and climate change. Even a brief input makes a difference! -> Use the template letters (ENG & ESP) provided by ICJAO NGO Alliance [you’ll find them in the comments]. -> Use the ICJAO NGO Alliance toolkit to know how to engage with this campaign. Join the movement and fight for your rights and climate justice 🌿⚖️

Honoring Juneteenth with Climate Justice. Climate justice is crucial in the fight against climate change, as we strive for a safer, cleaner earth for all, where everyone has access to clean energy and air. In honor of Juneteenth, here are some climate justice organization who are on the frontlines of climate justice, doing the work to make an equitable future a reality. 1. WE ACT for Environmental Justice ( https://www.weact.org/ ) works to build healthy communities ensuring strong and equal environmental protections for people of color and low income residents. 2. The Solutions Project ( https://lnkd.in/dNHqwkJ ) funds and amplifies climate justice solutions by Black, Indigenous, immigrant, women and communities of color building an equitable world. 3. The People's Collective for Environmental Justice ( https://pc4ej.org/ ) works to facilitate a just transition towards zero emissions and environmental justice, challenging the cultural and systemic roots of white supremacy.

💥 It's time for all kinds of companies and organisations to take action. Today, the environmental and social consequences of climate change extend beyond borders. From social justice to human rights, from climate protection to sustainable trade, the global challenges we face are everybody's business. That's why we're proud to support local initiatives and international organisations to increase their impact on the ground, whatever their geographical context. 🤝 We're in this together Find out more on https://lnkd.in/eyU5ZNdK

title: Fiona Corvan on LinkedIn: Friday marked the end of a chapter for me: at Holywell Trust, and as an… | 44 comments
headline: Fiona Corvan’s Post
post_text: Friday marked the end of a chapter for me: at Holywell Trust, and as an honorary Derry Girl. Irrespective of where I end up, I'll always be fierce advocate for peace and prosperity on the island - but in particular, the North West. I'm incredibly grateful for the special memories, connections, experience, friendships and opportunities that this period of my career has brought. Working on issues ranging from the constitutional future of the island to leadership capacity building in the sector and mini citizens assemblies in between - it has been a privilege. Times of sea-change often prompt deep reflection, but I'm trying to keep it light and focus on sharing some of my personal favourite standout moments from the last few years - along with a toast to the future from the ferry...

more_relevant_posts.post_text: leadership
The values I live by and apply to all areas of my life and career.

This is such a great analogy for startup founders trying in sales — It might feel uncomfortable, but if you're not willing to dive in, and lead from the front, no one's going to come with you. 🌊 #b2b #sales #startups #technology #artificialintelligence #entrepreneurship

We have thousands of women building up in the Cybersecurity pipelines, and we want those flood gates to open with Employers that will take them the rest of the way! Don't think about it. JUST DO IT! BE THE FIRST TO TAKE BOLD PLUNGES IN THE NAME OF YOUR TEAM! Women: Release your inhibitions! Let me see your excitement, for what's in front of you. A former Sales Manager in my past, just got a job at Crowdstrike She's now releasing her inhibitions, empowered. I feel like I'm about to jump out of my skin, bolder, and badder, more helpful to the world, when Employers receive women, instead of put hurdles in front of them. What Bright Lights can I put on the next bridge, to make life just a little more brighter for the world? When AI released, I leaped a second time. A company asked me to be open, be coachable into a new system. Illana Golan has been retreating with Richard Branson. How facinating that would be for me to tap some special people. I'm holding my feet to the fire, tired on my own frustrations with myself. I can drive like a machine, and then I can rest, at times. When my head spins, I have to use the ear seeds, massage and a hot tub to balance myself. I have a different process for working the mind, body and breathe. Truth is, your thoughts matter! In Sales, my Partners are an extension of me. Sometimes we might compete, but not if we're working it right, in good communication, and with a spirit that is good for the end users. We balance, support, and act as ONE TEAM! New learnings: a "one call close". You've never heard of it, I know. Me either. Not in Enterprise, I don't think, but I'm being open minded. Did you see that ZOOM took my advice on IVR? Its a new cloud offerring. Smartest move EVER! Its now REALTIME AI TRANSACTIONS EVERYWHERE. Yesterday, I had a first job interview in years. I always keep an open mind. The first question was self-sabatogging from a Hiring Mgr. It was, "Do you have a book of business?" Its a BIASED question toward having relationships with certain companies of which he could call out the names, specifically. You CAN'T do that anymore! My response was, "You're not giving me an opportunity to present the best of myself". He was set aback, and proceeded with the second question. It became a 30 min interview. I give him credit for his bravery to see a women. He's now someone in my fold to call on, for another reason in my Communities. I never throw opportunities away. I'll bring him value, and he will bring me value one day. This is a sales lesson, if you can't quite recognize it.
What a leadership lesson! What pool do you need to wade into first? Perhaps the new system, market, team behavior or framework? Leaders wade in first!!!
You should never be afraid to lead.
Growth Within our Organization has always been our key to Success !!

Incredible to see our #growth and journey towards being the Ultimate #Project Success Company, all while remembering that at Ferguson we have a very distinctive culture anchored in #customerservice . We are a #relationship business. Together we help build more than homes and office buildings. We help build relationships, #trust , #confidence and #community . #TogetherWeBuildBetter

Ever had doubts? The kind of doubts, uncertainties, worries, fears ... that have held you back? That have stopped you doing that thing you wanted to do. Maybe in business. Starting a business, levelling up a business, investing in a business. Maybe in relationships. Reaching out, carving out time for one another. Maybe in health. Starting your fitness journey. Starting to eat healthier. Maybe in life in general. Living the life You want, on your terms, with better boundaries and balance. If you don't slay these doubts, uncertainties, worries, fears ... they'll dominate your life. You'll play small, living a shadow of what you're capable of. Imagine the cost of letting that happen. Imagine the regret. Imagine the impact on you and those around you. THAT'S what we're going to tackle at the Extreme Confidence Breakthrough Experience, on 9th July. We're going to slay the dragons holding you back and Unleash your Extreme Confidence! 💥🏹 Tickets available now, including early bird tickets, saving you 25%. Click the link below, and I look forward to you joining us at Llanthony Secunda Priory, in historic Gloucester Docks on 9th July. ⬇️ https://buff.ly/3R4QSL0

post_text: The Bidwern Butj Uni team is looking for a Training and Development Officer to: * Support Aboriginal rangers and community members mapping their training and career pathways * Identify individual strengths and interests to develop personalised learning plans * Design and deliver tailored training sessions using various methods, including learning camps and on-the-job training * Evaluate training effectiveness and provide recommendations for improvement * Assist in organising learning exchanges across ranger groups If this sounds like your ideal role, please click on the link below for more information. https://lnkd.in/gyk5dVbj Mimal Land Management Warddeken Land Management Limited Karrkad Kanjdji Trust

Creating outcomes from good intentions: The best policies, guidelines and intentions won’t necessarily produce the outcomes your business is aiming to achieve. Where policy and guidelines are operationalised is the most exciting, and challenging, aspect of human services or social performance as it is the part where you grapple with human behaviour and other limitations like funding, timing and capability of the stakeholders involved. At #InlandRail we’re turning good intentions into job outcomes for locals in our alignment communities and creating opportunities for First Nations young men to start their careers. Finding the right partner service providers is critical, in this instance The Clontarf Foundation and NSW TAFE. Working with experienced First Nations colleagues is critical. Having jobs with our contractors is critical. Working within a solid social performance policy framework underpins the access to funding, timing and influence to drive the intended outcome. This is exciting stuff! Love this video by Dan at Whistling Wolf. Perfectly portrays how skills and jobs and a vision for a positive future uplifts people and I’m proud that this is the work I’m involved in #IRSkillsAcademy and #PublicSpiritedConsultancy . #PartnershipBrokersAssociation #SocialPerformance #ESG #Sustainability #ClosingtheGap https://lnkd.in/erXBp8tc

So today I’m co-facilitating a Support Planning session for Taye Training But, what are the benefits of having robust support plans in place? Here’s my take: 1. Having a structured approach improves individual outcomes, provides consistency, enabling individuals to achieve their aspirations 2. Support planning processes help evidence the support teams deliver, contributing to legal and regulatory compliance 3. Teams build confidence and reputation by working collaboratively with stakeholders, improving teams’ skills and job satisfaction For info and advice on how to get your support plans on point, please do get in touch! Image credit: Think Local Act Personal #LearningDisability #RealiseAchieveInspire #SupportPlanning

Following on from my previous post of the 25th Anniversary of the Jubilee Line Extension here is another fine example of how new railways can unlock & deliver numerous economic, financial and social benefits.

Between June 2022 and October 2023, passenger demand grew by around 40% - the fastest in the UK! Forecasts suggest passenger journeys will increase by a further 8% in 2024/25! 🚄 The primary objective of major infrastructure programmes is to deliver the benefits for the communities they serve and the benefits of transport infrastructure cannot be overstated; the MTR Elizabeth line is a brilliant example of this! It’s also great evidence of why major programmes like The Transpennine Route Upgrade (TRU) and #NorthernPowerhouseRail are so important for the people of the North by providing effective and efficient rail connectivity between the North’s major economic centres on more frequent, faster trains, running on a cleaner, greener and more reliable railway 🚄 #urbantransport #transport #rail #investment #economicgrowth #productivity #infrastructure #transformation #capacity #connectivity

This video perfectly captures a simple yet effective way to reach out to your "Uso." We all know the tips and advice, but sometimes, it’s as easy as picking up the phone to let someone know they’re on your mind and cared for. Have you called your loved one today?
What a powerful clip. We all need to do more of this.

Coming back from an incredible journey in Bonaire, I'm hit with the cliché yet profound realization: When you're immersed in what brings you joy, it transcends the very notion of 'work.' 🌊☀️ Navigating the vibrant reefs and soaking in the serene beauty of Bonaire was a dream. Yet, as I pack my bags to return to 'real life,' my heart is alight with an unexpected excitement. Why? Because 'real life' for me is about creating, exploring, and contributing to a world that's just as colorful and vibrant as the underwater paradise I'm leaving behind. The truth is, the boundary between work and play blurs when your work aligns with your passion. This isn't just about finding joy in what you do; it's about making what you do a source of joy. And yes, it comes with its share of challenges, deadlines, and the mundane. But at its core, it's fueled by an unquenchable desire to create, to make a difference, to push boundaries. As I head home, I'm not just returning to tasks and to-do lists. I'm diving back into my passion projects, into creating spaces that foster growth and inspiration, both for myself and for the community I hold dear. It's a reminder that 'home' isn't just a place; it's where your heart's work lies. To anyone standing at the crossroads of their dreams and the daunting path of 'real work'—take the plunge. Embrace the work that doesn't feel like work. Let your passions guide you, and you'll find that even after the most breathtaking escapes, coming back to your purpose feels just like coming home. Let's keep creating, dreaming, and transforming our 'real life' into a canvas as vast and mesmerizing as Bonaire's waters. Because when we do what we love, the world becomes a little more vibrant, a little more joyful, a little more like home. 💙🌿 #PassionProjects #JoyInWork #CreatingHome #BackToBasics #LifeIsCanvas #LearnLightLaugh #FirstTimeOnEarth #CannaLearnOnline #TheBox
Of course !

🌟 Supporting our international clients is one of the things Johns&Co Property Management does best! 🌍✨ Working with overseas landlords comes with its own unique challenges, such as: 🌐 Overcoming cultural & language barriers 🕒 Navigating different time zones ⚖️ Managing differences in laws & taxes 📩 Ensuring consistent communication across distances 🤝 Building trust with someone you’ve never met face to face At the heart of what we do is building trust and maintaining consistent communication with our clients. That’s why receiving feedback like this from our international base means so much. 🙌 It’s great that our clients feel at ease, well-informed, and confident knowing their properties are being expertly managed—no matter where they are in the world. 🌏 Here’s to more great feedback and continued success in 2025! 🎉💼🏡 #PropertyManagement #InternationalClients #GlobalReach #TrustpilotReviews #ProfessionalService #SuccessIn2025 #GodisGood #FinishStrong

Empowering Māori in Business and Trade Kia ora whānau! Here are some highlights from our recent Te Taumata hui in Ōtautahi: 🔹 Historical Strengths: Māori have always excelled in trade, from the 1800s to today. 🔹 Modern Achievements: Since 2019, we've shaped trade policies and secured indigenous trade chapters in NZ-UK and NZ-EU agreements. 🔹 Economic Opportunities: The Māori economy is thriving with £35 billion in assets. Key industries like fisheries, dairy, and kiwifruit are booming, offering immense growth potential in Europe. 🔹 Sustainable Development: Our ecological wisdom is globally recognised, leading the way in sustainable development. 🔹 Future Prospects: Initiatives like IPECTA are creating direct trade links with indigenous communities worldwide. Let's seize these opportunities and build a prosperous future together. Together, we thrive! Watch here: https://rb.gy/2w26kz #MāoriBusiness #InternationalTrade #SustainableGrowth #TeTaumata #Kaitiakitanga #IndigenousTrade #EconomicEmpowerment

Embracing True Prosperity! 🌍🌱 At Cicada, we firmly believe that true prosperity is not an isolated pursuit, but a collective responsibility. We envision a world where we recognize our interconnectedness with the environment and each other as integral parts of a larger ecosystem, understanding that if any part of the ecosystem fails, we all fail. We believe that true prosperity cannot be achieved unless we give back to the soil what we take out, and provide people the opportunity to thrive. Our mission is to foster a harmonious relationship between humanity and nature, ensuring the well-being of both. Growing Better Together! #Cicada #TrueProsperity #Zimbabwe #HarmoniousEcosystem #Sustainability

What Will You Do Today That Matters Tomorrow? In the fast-paced world of business, the choices we make today can have profound implications for our future. Recently, our team gathered for an inspiring group meeting featuring the founder of Lorena Transport, Bapak GT. Soerbaktia, remarkable 87-year-old visionary dedicated to enhancing transportation in Indonesia. His wealth of experience reminded us of our mission: to continually improve the customer experience, foster a healthy internal team environment, and make sustainable choices that benefit our planet. In addition to professional growth, personal mentorship plays a crucial role in shaping the future. I am actively supporting my children whom just started their entrepreneurial ventures. My son is joining our group, starting from the ground up to gain valuable firsthand experience gained overseas during his study in the US and Australia. Meanwhile, my daughter, a recent graduate from China, is venturing into tech and trading, demonstrating that innovation and education are powerful tools for success. Furthermore, the brainstorming sessions for EMA Ventures focus on harnessing technology to uplift farmers' lives. By integrating innovative solutions, we aspire to create a sustainable future for agriculture, empowering farmers with tools and resources that can enhance productivity and profitability. Today’s actions—whether it’s learning from a seasoned leader, mentoring the next generation, or fostering innovation—are stepping stones toward a brighter tomorrow. Let’s seize every opportunity to make meaningful contributions that will resonate for years to come. #foundersjourney #greatimpact #ekasarilorena @andrewbuntoro @michaelshi #leaderbetteringthesurroundings #mentoring #fosteringinnovation #upliftfarmerslive #singapore #indonesia #usa #asean #ekamichaelandrew

“I am not an OG, I am a man of all time. If you can beat time, you can beat time – It’s about what you do in time itself. Creativity is not a game of perfection” - ID Cabasa, Cabasa ogunade olumide idcabasa Excerpts from the webinar- “Navigating Pathways for Investment in Creatives” #idcabasa #investingincreatives #webinar #cfgafrica #excerpts

At Udao, we believe real change starts from the ground up. 🌱 Empowering communities isn’t just a strategy; it’s the future. Real value comes from within, leading to sustainable development. When communities are engaged and invested, we build a dynamic, adaptable economy. Let’s create an economy that truly works for everyone. #BottomUpEconomy #CommunityEmpowerment #InclusiveGrowth #RealValue #UDAO

❇Mr. Vikrom Kromadit, Chairman of AMATA Corporation Public Company, recently led the Annual General Shareholders meeting conducted as an e-AGM. In 2023, the company achieved its highest-ever total revenue, nearly ten billion Thai Baht, marking a 20% increase from the previous year. Also, during the AGM, the company expanded its board of directors from 7 to 9, welcoming Mrs. Kittiya Todhanakasem and Ms. Dendao Komolmas as new directors. ↗In the latest one-report, Mr. Vikrom reflected on the company's journey in his Chairman's message, highlighting resilience, adaptability, and transformative initiatives amid the global economic slowdown. One significant initiative was the successful restructuring of the utilities and services business group, culminating in a complete business transfer to AMATA U Company Limited. Mr. Vikrom also emphasized the development of the new AMATA Smart and Eco City projects in neighboring Laos. 🌳The company's commitment to good corporate governance and sustainability practices was recognized with prestigious awards, including the Sustainability Awards of Honor and acknowledgment from the Thailand Sustainability Investment (THSI) for six consecutive years with 'AAA' ESG ratings (both by the Stock Exchange of Thailand), among others. 🙏In conclusion, the Chairman expressed gratitude to all stakeholders for their contributions to the company's success and sustainable growth. Their collective efforts have propelled AMATA Corporation's journey towards greater resilience, innovation, and impact in the years ahead. (To learn more about the company and download its latest publications, please visit: https://lnkd.in/gmfv7Ev4 ) #amata #agm #journey #milestones #growth #performance

top_visible_comments.comment: Martin Rasheed Musah , cool to see innovation in action! Bolgatanga sounds like a hotbed for creativity. What's the vibe been like at the boot camp?

post_text_html: Today begun #youngAfricaInnovates project boot camp in Bolgatanga, for the upper east region. #caighana is fortunate to be selected along side six weavers from three of our communities groups. This boot camp is aimed at fine tuning the identified innovations prior to implementation. Significant milestone is the quality of innovators that have been scouted for the YAI project-UER bringing everyone on board without exclusion. #undpghana#mfbbaskets#mastercardfoundation

title: Centre for Cross Border Cooperation on LinkedIn: Earlier this year the Centre submitted evidence to the Lords European…
headline: Centre for Cross Border Cooperation’s Post
post_text: Earlier this year the Centre submitted evidence to the Lords European Affairs Committee inquiry on UK-EU data adequacy, focused on potential implications for cross-border cooperation - https://lnkd.in/ePaXaTCk Today the Committee published its letter to Secretary of State Peter Kyle with conclusions and recommendations arising from the inquiry - https://lnkd.in/efv8RgAx

more_relevant_posts.post_text: 🌍 EUDR Breaking news : several important announcements of the EU Commission earlier today: 🕑 A proposal to postpone the entry into force of the EUDR by one year, until 30 December 2025. This proposed amendment of the EUDR will be subject to legislative approval by the Council and the European Parliament. 📄 The publication of a long awaited Guidance Document 📄 The publication of a Communication on Strategic Framework of International Cooperation Engagement
The latest European Council conclusions set out the strategic priorities that will shape the next term of the European Commission 2024-2029 #EU #strategicpriorities

🎥 “Better regulation is about making sure regulation achieves what its intended goals are, and it does so efficiently” Hear from Zach Meyers , author of Centre for European Reform ’s better regulation report, on how the next European Commission can create better and more efficient regulation across Europe. #EuropeUnlocked #EU #BetterRegulation

The European Parliament has been influential in shaping a range of new laws these past years. And it has made a difference during this term which has not lacked for challenges 🧗♀️. With an unprecedented pandemic closely followed by war on the EU’s eastern border, the Union, with Parliament frequently in the lead, has developed strong responses to these extraordinary challenges. 💼 As the current – 2019 to 2024 – term wraps up, here's a selection (provided by the European Parliamentary Research Service ) of the many achievements of the Parliament over the past five years in seeking to improve the #EuropeanUnion for its citizens. 🔎 Examples of Parliament’s impact: europa.eu/!y36GCN

AEJ Belgium is pleased to invite you to our next event: 'UNLOCKING EU TRANSPARENCY- THE POWER OF PUBLIC ACCESS TO DOCUMENTS'. We will be joined by guest speakers including Ombudsman Emily O’Reilly, MEP Evin Incir and Follow the Money journalist Lise Witteman. REGISTER HERE: https://lnkd.in/evwaWBzz Journalists have the right to access documents from EU institutions, bodies, and agencies, but they often face delays and obstacles. Last year, the EU Ombudsman found that the European Commission missed transparency deadlines in 85 percent of cases — a clear sign that there is still much work to be done to ensure compliance with EU law. Moreover, despite their growing importance to the EU, sensitive topics like public security, defence, and military matters are typically exempt from the rules on access to documents. Join us at our event as we explore these challenges and discuss ways to advocate for greater transparency in the EU. Whether you're a journalist, researcher, or simply passionate about transparency in governance, this event will provide valuable insights and practical strategies to push for more open access to crucial EU information. We look forward to seeing you there.

The #Council adopts the #InteroperableEuropeAct : more efficient digital public services across the EU interconnecting digital public administrations. Also very important IMO is that the #EuropeanInteroperabilityFramework has a formal recognition. Now only the publication on the EU #OfficialJournal is missing https://lnkd.in/ezhmg3ye

In an unprecedented move, the USA advanced in the production of legislation including an analysis of the EU and UK lists in order to harmonise the USA designations list. Would the EU and UK follow a similar action of harmonisation with like minded jurisdictions? This level of alignment may create a de facto multilateral list of designated persons and entities overcoming the blockage at UN level. #complianceiscoming

Representing Portugal in the discussions on the European Court of Auditors' "Special report 21/2024: State aid in times of crisis – Swift reaction but shortcomings in the Commission’s monitoring and inconsistencies in the framework to support the EU’s industrial policy objectives" https://lnkd.in/diAKQYzT Whether you agree with the Court's conclusions or not, it's a good reminder that the transitional period in which the EU finds itself cannot be reconciled with the weakening of the single market, particularly through state aid.

#Delivery through #Democracy - that is indeed what the EU is all about 💪🇪🇺 And useful to recall the quite astounding process which enables us to co-create ambitious and important results like those achieved in the past mandate: 💡strategic foresight and political agenda setting, by Heads of State and Government in the #EuropeanCouncil and #CitizenEngagement 🔬🧑🧑🧒🧒 impact analyses and public consultations to prepare a proposal that both in in line with the Treaties, knowledge based and with the best interests of the whole of Europe in mind, prepared by the #EuropeanCommission ✅ subsidiarity checks by national parliaments 🧑🧑🧒🧒🧑🧑🧒🧒 opinions by local and regional representatives as well as of social partners and the private sector - and commentary, debate and lobbying from all those who take an active interest Parallel negotiations by 🇪🇺 directly elected representatives in the European Parliament 🏰 the national governments we have put in place, who continually base their mandates on interaction with the national parliaments they report to 🤝 political agreement on a common solution 📃a final result, enshrined in law 🔂 And now, dear folks, you are again in the driver’s seat, as it is up to companies, cities, regions, individuals, civil society organisations, universities and everyone else concerned, to implement and apply what we have together agreed - and together we’ll enjoy the intended benefits. 🍀📈🫶 And to #useyourvote on 6-9 June, so the politicians representing you there will help steer the cooperation in the way you want it to go the next five years. #TeamWorkMakesTheDreamWork 🇪🇺
